snippet: Herculaneum, despite having Pompeii as its neighbor, has become a textbook case of successful archaeological conservation.
abstract: Archaeological site Herculaneum is a textbook case of successful archaeological conservation thanks to slow, painstaking work and financial support from American philanthropist David W Packard; skeletal casts of human remains are displayed in ancient warehouses at the site that are accessible to visitors for the first time since being excavated some 30 years ago.
lead_paragraph: Herculaneum, despite having Pompeii as its neighbor, has become a textbook case of successful archaeological conservation.

headline.seo: Herculaneum’s Ruins Are Revived by Philanthropy
